SENT.plain: Self expandable metal stent can be used both as palliative treatment for malignant colorectal obstruction and as a bridge to surgery in patients with potentially resectable colorectal cancer
Here, we report a case of successful relief of malignant stomal obstruction using a metal stent
A 56-year-old man underwent loop ileostomy and was given palliative chemotherapy for ascending colon cancer with peritoneal carcinomatosis
Eight months after the surgery, he complained of abdominal pain and decreased fecal output
Computed tomography and endoscopy revealed malignant stomal obstruction
Due to his poor clinical condition, we inserted the stent at the stomal orifice, instead of additional surgery, and his obstructive symptoms were successfully relieved
Stent insertion is thought to be a good alternative treatment for malignant stomal obstruction, instead of surgery
